Public Property DisableContentCRC64Validation As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.DisableContentCRC64Validation : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that CRC64 validation will be disabled when downloading blobs.
Docs.value: Use true to disable CRC64 validation; false to enable CRC64 validation. Default is false.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property DisableContentMD5Validation As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.DisableContentMD5Validation : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that MD5 validation will be disabled when downloading blobs.
Docs.value: Use true to disable MD5 validation; false to enable MD5 validation. Default is false.
Docs.remarks:
When downloading a blob, if the value already exists on the blob, the Storage service will include the MD5 hash of the entire blob as a header. This option controls whether or not the Storage Client will validate that MD5 hash on download. See for more details.
## Examples [!code-csharp[Disable_Content_MD5_Validation_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_DisableContentMD5Validation "Disable Content MD5 Validation Sample")]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property StoreContentMD5 As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.StoreContentMD5 : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to indicate that an MD5 hash will be calculated and stored when uploading a blob.
Docs.value: Use true to calculate and store an MD5 hash when uploading a blob; otherwise, false. Defaults to false.
Docs.remarks: This property is not supported for the Append* APIs. The StoreBlobContentMD5 request option instructs the Storage Client to calculate the MD5 hash of the blob content during an upload operation. This value is then stored on the blob object as the Content-MD5 header. This option applies only to upload operations. This is useful for validating the integrity of the blob upon later download, and compatible with the Content-MD5 header as defined in the HTTP spec. If using the Storage Client for later download, if the Content-MD5 header is present, the MD5 hash of the content will be validated, unless "DisableContentMD5Validation" is set. Note that this value is not validated on the Azure Storage service on either upload or download of data; it is merely stored and returned. ## Examples [!code-csharp[Store_Blob_Content_MD5_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_StoreBlobContentMD5 "Store Blob Content MD5 Sample")]

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UseTransactionalCRC64 As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.UseTransactionalCRC64 : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to calculate and send/validate content CRC64 for transactions.
Docs.value: Use true to calculate and send/validate content CRC64 for transactions; otherwise, false. Default is false.
Docs.remarks: The UseTransactionalCRC64 option instructs the Storage Client to calculate and validate the CRC64 hash of individual Storage REST operations. For a given REST operation, if this value is set, both the Storage Client and the Storage service will calculate the CRC64 hash of the transferred data, and will fail if the values do not match. This value is not persisted on the service or the client. This option applies to both upload and download operations. Note that HTTPS does a similar check during transit. If you are using HTTPS, we recommend this feature be off.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Property UseTransactionalMD5 As Nullable(Of Boolean)
member this.UseTransactionalMD5 : Nullable<bool> with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value to calculate and send/validate content MD5 for transactions.
Docs.value: Use true to calculate and send/validate content MD5 for transactions; otherwise, false. Default is false.
Docs.remarks: The UseTransactionalMD5 option instructs the Storage Client to calculate and validate the MD5 hash of individual Storage REST operations. For a given REST operation, if this value is set, both the Storage Client and the Storage service will calculate the MD5 hash of the transferred data, and will fail if the values do not match. This value is not persisted on the service or the client. This option applies to both upload and download operations. Note that HTTPS does a similar check during transit. If you are using HTTPS, we recommend this feature be off. ## Examples [!code-csharp[Use_Transactional_MD5_Sample](~/azure-storage-net/Test/ClassLibraryCommon/Blob/MD5FlagsTest.cs#sample_ChecksumOptions_UseTransactionalMD5 "Use Transactional MD5 Sample")]
